1.$description:
Level 1. Represents the lowest layer in the stack. This is the foundation that everything else sits on, like the app's main background.

Common uses: Application background, page base layer, lowest-level containers.

2.$description:
Level 2. Represents elements that sit on top of the bottom layer. Creates visual hierarchy through subtle elevation.

Common uses: Cards, containers, form fields, dropdown menus.

3.$description:
Level 3. Represents elements that sit on top of the middle layer. Creates strong visual emphasis through maximum elevation.

Common uses: Popovers, tooltips, highlighted containers.

1.$description:
Highest contrast color for text and icons in important content. Creates maximum readability and emphasis for key information.

Common uses: Headings, labels, emphasized text, primary buttons.

2.$description:
Primary color for text and icons in general content. Provides optimal readability for extended reading while reducing visual strain.

Common uses: Body text, primary content, default icons, form inputs.

3.$description:
Reduced emphasis color for text and icons in secondary information. Creates visual hierarchy through lower contrast.

Common uses: Supporting text, metadata, secondary information, placeholders.

accent.$description:
Contrasting color for text and icons in interactive elements or design focus. Creates visual distinction for actionable items.

Common uses: Links, buttons, interactive icons, highlighted elements.

success.$description:
Primary color for text and icons in success content. Communicates positive outcomes and completion states.

Common uses: Success message text, completion text, positive indicators.

danger.$description:
Primary color for text and icons in error content. Communicates problems, warnings, and destructive actions.

Common uses: Error message text, validation text, destructive action labels.

warning.$description:
Primary color for text and icons in warning content. Communicates caution and potential issues requiring attention.

Common uses: Warning message text, alert text, important notifications.

1.$description:
Enhanced border color for interactive states. Creates strong visual definition for important boundaries.

Common uses: Focus states, hover states, active elements, primary containers.

2.$description:
Standard border color for general use. Provides balanced visual definition for common UI elements.

Common uses: Containers, cards, dividers, separators, default form inputs.

3.$description:
Softer border color for minimal separation. Creates subtle visual boundaries that don't dominate the UI.

Common uses: Subtle dividers, grouped content, secondary containers, table rows.

focus.$description:
Focus state indicator color. Provides clear visual feedback for keyboard navigation and accessibility.

Common uses: Focus rings, keyboard navigation highlights, selection indicators.

success.$description:
Border color for success containers. Reinforces positive status through visual framing.

Common uses: Success alert borders, confirmation boundaries, completed state indicators.

danger.$description:
Border color for error containers. Emphasizes critical information through visual framing.

Common uses: Error alert borders, validation boundaries, destructive action containers.

warning.$description:
Border color for warning containers. Frames cautionary information with distinct boundary.

Common uses: Warning alert borders, notice boundaries, attention-requiring elements.

hover.$description:
Light overlay for gentle interactive effects. Creates subtle visual feedback during user interaction.

Common uses: Button hover states, link hover states, soft interactions, menu items.

selected.$description:
Strong overlay for emphasized selection states. Creates distinct visual indication of active or selected elements.

Common uses: Selected list items, active tabs, chosen options, current navigation item.

text.$description:
Lowest emphasis text color for unavailable options. Creates visual differentiation between interactive and non-interactive elements.

Common uses: Disabled buttons, inactive form elements, unavailable options, placeholders.

background.$description:
Muted background color for disabled elements. Reduces visual prominence of non-interactive elements in the UI.

Common uses: Disabled buttons, inactive form controls, unavailable options.

border.$description:
Muted border color for disabled element boundaries. Creates subtle containment while indicating non-interactive state.

Common uses: Disabled form inputs, inactive controls, unavailable action boundaries.

title.$description: Text color for accordion triggers/headers. Used for the clickable area that expands/collapses content.

description.$description: Text color for accordion content. Applied to the expandable text within accordion panels.

chevron.$description: Color for the accordion expansion indicator icon. Visually signals the collapsed/expanded state.

border.$description: Border color for accordion items. Provides visual separation between accordion panels.

title.$description: Title text color for informational alerts. Ensures high visibility for the alert heading.

description.$description: Description text color for informational alerts. Provides readable contrast for alert content.

background.$description: Background color for informational alerts. Creates visual distinction from surrounding content.

border.$description: Border color for informational alerts. Subtly defines the alert's boundaries.

title.$description: Text color for danger alerts. Communicates critical information through high-contrast red text.

description.$description: Description text color for danger alerts. Ensures readability while maintaining the error state styling.

background.$description: Background color for danger alerts. Creates subtle but recognizable error state styling.

border.$description: Border color for danger alerts. Provides definition for error state alerts.

text.$description: Text color for avatar initials or text. Ensures visibility against the avatar background.

background.$description: Background color for avatar components. Provides contrast for text or image content.

border.$description: Border color for avatars. Creates subtle definition around the avatar element.

text.$description: Text color for secondary badges. Provides readable contrast on secondary badge styling.

background.$description: Background color for secondary badges. Creates less prominent badge styling for secondary information.

border.$description: Border color for secondary badges. Matches background for clean, cohesive appearance.

text.$description: Text color for outline badges. Ensures readability for badges with transparent backgrounds.

background.$description: Background color for neutral badges. Creates subtle visual styling for general-purpose indicators.

border.$description: Border color for outline badges. Creates definition for badges without background fill.

text.$description: Text color for success badges. Communicates positive status through readable green text.

border.$description: Border color for success badges. Provides subtle definition for success state indicators.

background.$description: Background color for success badges. Creates a subtle but recognizable success indicator.

text.$description: Text color for danger badges. Communicates error or warning status with high visibility.

border.$description: Border color for danger badges. Creates definition for error or warning indicators.

background.$description: Background color for danger badges. Provides subtle visual indication of error states.

text.$description: Text color for warning badges. Signals caution states with readable amber text.

border.$description: Border color for warning badges. Defines the boundary of caution status indicators.

background.$description: Background color for warning badges. Creates subtle but recognizable caution indicators.

text.$description: Text color for running state badges. Indicates active or in-progress operations.

border.$description: Border color for running state badges. Defines the boundary of active status indicators.

background.$description: Background color for running state badges. Creates subtle visual indication of in-progress states.

text.$description: Text color for merged state badges. Indicates completed merge actions in version control contexts.

border.$description: Border color for merged state badges. Defines the boundary of merge status indicators.

background.$description: Background color for merged state badges. Creates subtle but recognizable merge indicators.

text.$description: Text color for AI-related badges. Ensures high contrast against AI badge gradient border.

background.$description: Background color for AI-related badges. Creates a subtle backdrop that highlights the gradient border.

border.$description: Gradient border color for AI-related badges. Creates distinctive multi-color styling to highlight AI functionality.

item-inactive.$description: Text color for inactive breadcrumb items. Provides reduced emphasis for previous navigation steps.

item-current.$description: Text color for current breadcrumb item. Emphasizes the user's current location in the navigation hierarchy.

separator.$description: Color for breadcrumb separator characters. Creates visual distinction between breadcrumb items.

text.$description: Text and icon color for primary action buttons. Ensures maximum contrast and visibility for primary CTA elements.

background.$description: Background color for primary action buttons. Creates emphasis for the most important action in a given context.

border.$description: Border color for primary action buttons. Matches background for clean, cohesive appearance.

text.$description: Text and icon color for secondary action buttons. Provides readable contrast for supporting actions.

background.$description: Background color for secondary action buttons. Creates visual hierarchy between primary and secondary actions.

border.$description: Border color for secondary action buttons. Matches background for clean, cohesive appearance.

text.$description: Text color for unselected outline buttons. Provides readable contrast against transparent backgrounds.

icon.$description: Icon color for unselected outline buttons. Creates subtle emphasis for button icons.

border.$description: Border color for unselected outline buttons. Defines the clickable area with a visible boundary.

background.$description: Background color for unselected outline buttons.

text.$description: Text color for selected outline buttons. Increases contrast for active button states.

icon.$description: Icon color for selected outline buttons. Increases visibility for active button states.

border.$description: Border color for selected outline buttons. Creates stronger visual indication of the active state.

background.$description: Background color for selected outline buttons.

text.$description: Text color for unselected ghost buttons. Provides readable contrast for minimal styling.

icon.$description: Icon color for unselected ghost buttons. Creates subtle emphasis for button icons.

text.$description: Text color for selected ghost buttons. Increases contrast for active button states.

icon.$description: Icon color for selected ghost buttons. Increases visibility for active button states.

text.$description: Text color for success buttons. Communicates positive actions through readable green text.

background.$description: Background color for success buttons. Creates subtle but recognizable positive action styling.

border.$description: Border color for success buttons. Provides definition for positive action buttons.

hover.$description: Hover state background color for success buttons. Creates subtle feedback for user interaction.

active.$description: Active state background color for success buttons. Provides stronger visual feedback for clicks/presses.

text.$description: Text color for danger buttons. Communicates destructive or warning actions through high-contrast red text.

background.$description: Background color for danger buttons. Creates subtle but recognizable destructive action styling.

border.$description: Border color for danger buttons. Provides definition for destructive action buttons.

hover.$description: Hover state background color for danger buttons. Creates subtle feedback for user interaction.

active.$description: Active state background color for danger buttons. Provides stronger visual feedback for clicks/presses.

text.$description: Text color for AI-powered buttons. Ensures high contrast against AI button gradient border.

border.$description: Gradient border color for AI-powered buttons. Creates distinctive multi-color styling to highlight AI functionality.

background.$description: Background color for card components. Creates a distinct surface that appears elevated from the page background.

border.$description: Border color for card components. Defines the card boundaries and enhances visual separation from surrounding content.

title.$description: Text color for dialog titles. Ensures high visibility and emphasis for the modal heading.

description.$description: Text color for dialog content. Provides readable contrast for the modal's primary text content.

background.$description: Background color for dialog components. Creates a distinct surface for modal content that appears above the main UI.

backdrop.$description: Overlay color behind dialog components. Creates focus on the dialog by dimming content underneath.

background.$description: Background color for dropdown menus. Creates a distinct surface for selectable options.

border.$description: Border color for dropdown menus container.

text.$description: Text color for dropdown menu items. Ensures readability of selectable options.
Text color for dropdown menu delete-item.

hover.$description: Specific hover state color for dropdown delete-item.

grey.$description: Neutral base color for the diff interface that allows code and difference highlights to remain visually prominent.

add-content.$description: Green background highlighting newly added code lines while maintaining readability.

add-lineNumber.$description: Background for line numbers of added code, providing visual connection to added content.

add-content-highlight.$description: Stronger emphasis color for specific character changes within added lines.

add-widget.$description: Background for interactive UI elements related to added content.

add-widget-color.$description: Text/icon color for add-related interactive elements, ensuring readability.

del-content.$description: Red background highlighting removed code lines without causing eye strain.

del-lineNumber.$description: Background for line numbers of deleted code, connecting numbers to removed content.

del-content-highlight.$description: Stronger emphasis color for specific character changes within deleted lines.

plain-content.$description: Neutral background for unchanged code that allows modified content to stand out.

plain-lineNumber.$description: Background for line numbers of unchanged code, maintaining visual rhythm.

plain-lineNumber-color.$description: Text color for unchanged line numbers, visually subdued compared to changed content.

empty-content.$description: Background for placeholder spaces and empty lines, maintaining visual continuity.

hunk-content.$description: Background for diff section headers ('hunks') that indicate which part of the file is displayed.

hunk-lineNumber.$description: Background for line numbers in section headers.

hunk-content-color.$description: Text color for section header content showing file position information.

expand-content.$description: Background for controls that expand/collapse code sections to show additional context.

text.$description: Text color for input field content. Ensures readability of user-entered information.

placeholder.$description: Text color for input field placeholders. Provides lower-contrast guidance text that doesn't compete with entered content.

icon.$description: Color for icons within input components. Creates visual harmony with placeholder text and decorative elements.

background.$description: Background color for input fields. Creates a distinct surface for user interaction and data entry.

border.$description: Border color for input fields. Defines the input area with a visible boundary for improved usability.

text.$description: Text color for form labels and field identifiers. Ensures high contrast for important contextual information.

default.$description: Default color for text links. Creates distinct visual identification of interactive text elements.

visited.$description: Visited state color for text links. Differentiates links the user has already activated.

text.$description: Unselected tab item text.
Selected tab item text.

border.$description: Selected tab item border.
Navigation container border.

background.$description: Navigation tabs container background.

border.$description: Border color for pipeline connection arrows. Defines the visual path between pipeline components.
Gradient border color for active pipeline arrows. Visually indicates data flow between active pipeline components.

background.$description: Gradient background for pipeline cards. Creates a visually distinctive surface for pipeline visualization elements.

border.$description: Gradient border for pipeline cards. Enhances the visual depth and distinction of pipeline components.
Animated gradient border for running pipeline states. Provides visual indication of active processing.
Border color for error pipeline states. Clearly indicates failed or problematic pipeline execution.
Border color for completed pipeline states. Indicates successful pipeline execution.

background.$description: The background color for the primary/top-level canvas where pipeline components are arranged. Creates the base visual layer for the main workflow area.

border.$description: Solid border for the outermost pipeline canvas elements. Defines the boundaries of the top-level workflow container.

background.$description: Background color for nested/secondary canvas elements that appear within the main workflow. Provides visual distinction for grouped pipeline components.

border.$description: Border styling applied to nested canvas containers. Creates clear visual boundaries between different sections within the pipeline visualization.

dotes.$description: Refers to the dotted pattern visible in the background of the workspace.

background.$description: Background color for navigation components. Creates a consistent foundation for navigation elements.

border.$description: Border color for navigation components. Creates visual boundaries and separation from adjacent content.

separator.$description: Color for separators between navigation sections. Creates visual organization within the navigation structure.

text.$description: Text color for unselected navigation items. Provides readable but less emphasized styling for available options.

icon.$description: Icon color for unselected navigation items. Creates subtle visual indicators for navigation options.

text.$description: Text color for selected navigation items. Increases contrast to highlight the current location.

icon.$description: Icon color for selected navigation items. Creates stronger visual indication of the current selection.

text.$description: Text color for Logo in sidebar navigation.

icon.$description: Icon color for Logo in sidebar navigation.

background.$description: Search input specific background on sidebar navigation.

border.$description: Search input specific border on sidebar navigation.

placeholder.$description: Search input specific placeholder on sidebar navigation.

background.$description: Search input specific button background on sidebar navigation.

border.$description: Search input specific button border on sidebar navigation.

text.$description: Search input specific button text on sidebar navigation.

username.$description: Username in the footer sidebar navigation menu.

data.$description: User data in the footer sidebar navigation menu.

thumb.$description: Color for scrollbar thumb/handle elements. Provides subtle contrast against the scrollbar track for improved usability.

item.$description: Color for unselected items in selection controls. Provides readable but less emphasized styling for available options.

background.$description: Background color for unselected state in selection controls. Creates visual distinction from selected items.

border.$description: Border color for unselected elements in selection controls. Defines the clickable area with a visible boundary.

item.$description: Color for selected items in selection controls. Creates high contrast against selected background state.

background.$description: Background color for selected state in selection controls. Creates strong visual indication of active selection.

border.$description: Border color for selected elements in selection controls. Reinforces the selected state with consistent styling.

background.$description: Background color for separator elements. Creates visual division between content sections with a subtle line or space.
Animation color that sweeps across skeleton elements. Creates a "shimmer" effect indicating content loading states.

base.$description: Background color for slider tracks. Represents the full range of available values in an unselected state.

progress.$description: Filled portion color for slider tracks. Visually represents the selected value or range within the track.

base.$description: Color for segment markers on the unfilled track portion. Creates visual indicators for specific values or intervals.

progress.$description: Color for segment markers on the filled track portion. Maintains visibility of markers within the selected range.

background.$description: Background color for slider handles. Creates a distinct, interactive element for adjusting values.

border.$description: Border color for slider handles. Provides definition and contrast for the interactive control.

completed.$description: Color for success status indicators. Communicates completed or positive states.

cancelled.$description: Color for danger status indicators. Communicates error or critical warning states.

warning.$description: Color for warning status indicators. Communicates caution or potential issue states.

running.$description: Color for running status indicators. Communicates active or in-progress operations.

merged.$description: Color for merged status indicators. Communicates successful integration or completion in version control contexts.

action-required.$description: Color for action-required status indicators. Communicates that user attention or intervention is needed.

waiting.$description: Color for pending status indicators. Communicates in waiting states.

thumb.$description: Color for the movable thumb element in unselected switch controls. Creates visual contrast against the track.

background.$description: Background color for the unselected state of switch controls. Creates visual distinction from the selected state.

thumb.$description: Color for the movable thumb element in selected switch controls. Provides clear contrast against the active track.

background.$description: Background color for the selected state of switch controls. Creates strong visual indication of active state.

text.$description: Text color for table header cells. Ensures readability of column labels and titles.

background.$description: Background color for table header rows. Creates visual distinction between headers and data rows.

alternate-background.$description: Background color for alternate table rows. Improves readability by differentiating adjacent rows.

border.$description: Border color for table rows. Provides subtle separation between data rows.

text.$description: Text color for table cell content. Ensures high readability of tabular data.

background.$description: Background color for the tabs container. Creates a consistent foundation for tab elements.

border.$description: Border color for tab containers and separators. Provides subtle definition for tab boundaries.

text.$description: Text color for unselected tab items. Provides reduced emphasis for available but inactive tabs.

background.$description: Background color for unselected tab items. Creates visual distinction from the active tab.

border.$description: Border color for unselected tab items. Maintains consistent styling with the tab background.

text.$description: Text color for the selected tab item. Increases contrast to highlight the active tab.

background.$description: Background color for the selected tab item. Creates strong visual indication of the active tab.

border.$description: Border color for the selected tab item. Reinforces the active state with defined boundaries.

background.$description: Background color for blue tags. Creates a distinct surface with blue theme styling.

background-subtle.$description: Subtle background variation for blue tags. Provides a softer alternative for less emphasis.

border.$description: Border color for blue tags.

background-subtle.$description: Subtle background variation for orange tags. Provides a softer alternative for less emphasis.

border.$description: Border color for orange tags.

text.$description: Text color for pink tags. Ensures readability while maintaining the pink color theme.

background.$description: Background color for pink tags. Creates a distinct surface with pink theme styling.

background-subtle.$description: Subtle background variation for pink tags. Provides a softer alternative for less emphasis.

background-subtle.$description: Subtle background variation for purple tags. Provides a softer alternative for less emphasis.

background-subtle.$description: Subtle background variation for yellow tags. Provides a softer alternative for less emphasis.

border.$description: Border color for yellow tags.

title.$description: Title text color for informational toast notifications. Ensures high visibility for the notification headline.

description.$description: Description text color for informational toast notifications. Provides readable contrast for notification content.

background.$description: Background color for informational toast notifications. Creates visual distinction from UI content beneath.

border.$description: Border color for informational toast notifications. Subtly defines the notification's boundaries.

title.$description: Title text color for danger toast notifications. Provides maximum contrast against the error background.

description.$description: Description text color for danger toast notifications. Ensures readability of critical information.

background.$description: Background color for danger toast notifications. Creates high-visibility indication of errors or warnings.

border.$description: Border color for danger toast notifications. Reinforces the critical nature of the notification message.

text.$description: Text color for tooltip content. Ensures readability of helpful contextual information.

background.$description: Background color for tooltips. Creates a distinct surface for contextual information that appears above UI elements.

0.$description:
No shadow. 
Common uses: Flat designs, disabled states, removing shadows on mobile.

1.$description:
Small shadow. 
Common uses: Buttons in their rest state, form inputs, subtle UI elements.

2.$description:
Default shadow. 
Common uses: Cards, dropdowns, popovers in their default state.

3.$description:
Medium shadow. 
Common uses: Elevated cards, active buttons, interactive elements on hover.

4.$description:
Large shadow. 
Common uses: Modals, floating panels, navigation dropdowns.

5.$description:
Extra large shadow. 
Common uses: Large modals, sidebars, elevated content sections.

6.$description:
Extra extra large shadow.
Common uses: This aggressive shadow is typically used sparingly in UI design, primarily for elements that need maximum visual emphasis and elevation.

inner.$description:
Inner shadow. 
Common uses: Pressed buttons, selected states, inset form fields.

0.$description: Transparent shadow color. Used when no shadow effect is desired.

1.$description: Light shadow color with 40% opacity. Creates subtle depth for small UI elements.

2.$description: Medium shadow color with 40% opacity. Provides balanced depth for common UI components.

3.$description: Medium shadow color with 35% opacity. Creates moderate depth for elevated components.

4.$description: Deep shadow color with 35% opacity. Provides significant depth for floating elements.

5.$description: Very deep shadow color with 35% opacity. Creates dramatic elevation for modal content.

6.$description: Extremely deep shadow color with 40% opacity. Provides maximum depth for highly elevated elements.

inner.$description: Subtle inner shadow color with 7% opacity. Creates inset effect for pressed or focused states.

focus.$description: Focus ring effect with background offset and accent border.
